reviewText: This is an AMAZING show.  I totally understand why it won a Tony Award.  Jay was on stage for almost 2 hours with energy to spare.  What a great show; it's not just jokes and  wooden people, there's a heartfelt story here.  I learned, I laughed and even shed a tear or two.  We are so lucky to be able to see it since we missed when it was live.  Watch this show - you will not be sorry.

I mean, sure, I was a fan of SOAP... at eight years old (when it went off the air in 1981). But it was not until 2006 that I became a true Jay Johnson fan -- when I saw this show live in Cambridge, Massachusetts.

I know that in popular culture today, the idea of ventriloquism tends to sound like the punchline to its own lame joke. But believe me, seeing this show will forever change your perspective on this vastly underappreciated art form. This was by turns one of the funniest (we were quoting it around my house for months on end) and literally one of the most moving performances I ever saw in my life. I am so pleased it's finally being released on DVD. I can only hope it manages to convey all the charm and brilliance of the live show.

PS for the headline reference: http://monkeyjoke.com/jay-johnson-ventriloquist-steps

OK, obviously I haven't seen the film but I saw the Broadway play five times and loved it.  I roared with laughter and cried a bit, too. This is one very talented performer and I look forward to getting and watching the DVD.
He is one of the best

LOVED IT!!!!!! Better than Jeff Dunham! My husband and I enjoyed it enough that halfway through we started over and had our 12 and 10 yr old daughters come watch with us. If I recall maybe a few curse words  but nothing they wouldn't here on regular cable channels.  We will probably watch this one again!
What a great one-man show. If you want to learn a bit about ventriloquism and laugh along the way, don't miss this heartwarming one-man show.

I was a die-hard Soap fan. Didn't miss one show. Each character in their own right was hilarious. I was always impressed how Jay Johnson could make me believe Chuck & Bob were really Two different people.
 That being said, I assumed, as hundreds had before him, Mr. Johnson would just fade into obscurity, with the occasional cameo appearance.
 Then I watched TWO & ONLY.
 I'm a big crusty old biker that isn't moved by much, but this guy is the real deal.  Amazing talent aside, this guy is so down to earth and connected with his audience I felt like he was one of my friends. (short of the Tattoos and Harley). When he was done, not only did want more humor, I wanted to hear more stories.
 My wife and I wanted more. We started looking on line for more Jay Johnson, and found his blog. How this guy takes you in and wraps you up in whatever he's into at that time is amazing.
 Two days later, my wife wasn't done. She surprised me with two tickets to a live performance in Fresno in August.  We have scheduled an entire vacation in California, just so we can attend Jays show at a winery no less.
 If you're not familiar with Jay Johnson, I strongly urge you to buy his dvd and watch. You will be hooked.

 If this comment somehow gets to Mr. Johnson, I would like to personally thank him for showing me that personality, humility and and intelligence can still be hilarious. Something obviously overlooked by so many of todays "mega stars".
 See you in Fresno in August.
Slow and dated.... senior citizen entertainment.
Very good show - we liked him on Soap and he is just as good as stand up comic
Hilarious. Have loved Jay's comedy since SOAP. This special gives great insight to the history of ventriloquism and Jay's eventual pairing with Bob. Loved it.
Not only was this funny it was also an insightful look into the history of ventriloquism! Jay is very gifted and talented and being a SOAP fan, he did not disappoint!!
This is a must see for anyone who likes ventriloquism. A comprehensive history of ventriloquism. A great performance by Jay Johnson.
Not just entertaining, but educational as well.  Gives a good history and education in ventriloquism.

This was a really funny special. I loved the history he share at the same time making you crack up.  I really enjoyed watching this.  In fact I have watched it twice now.  Anyone who likes comedy, stand-up, or ventriloquists will love this special.
Excellent. Loved it!
I am no longer a dummy on the art and history of a ventriloquist, Jay was very entertaining and educational !!!!
Informative and funny
Not to much into it.
Informative, funny and heartwarming.
very funny. well done. worth watching
It was very funny.
Laughs and more laughs
Didn't care for it.
Very interesting show.  Great Ventriloquist, and I learned a lot about the history of ventriloquism.  Quite a nice surprise, since the last time I had seen Jay was on SOAP!!
Loved it! Even my 17yo son was laughing out loud.
exceptional

This was a very impressive show.  We laughed, we cried, we were enlightened.  Jay is a wonderful storyteller and in his one man show (ok, one man and many wooden friends) he teaches and shares - and as an audience, we learn and laugh.  We learned about ventriloquism and it's history in a way that we weren't lectured or made to feel like we needed to take notes - he made the history personal and brought it to life in his own voice "thrown" into the carved wooden inanimate objects. By the end of the show, you understand how it works, how it's done and yet, by magic and by the way Jay puts it all together, you still feel that the carved wood at the end of his arm is alive and can speak for himself.  I can't gush enough at how wonderful this was done.
Jay gives a very interesting presentation on the history of his art.  He is so truly talented.  My husband and I both really enjoyed the show.  Funny, touching, interesting, and amazing talent
Very enjoyable! Jay takes this performance beyond the usual ventriloquist venue.

Jay Johnson is one of the best ventriloquist!  I loved him when he was on Soap.  I also had the opportunity to see him live once years ago and he was hilarious! This video is a little different than your typical ventriloquist video though.  Even though he has several of his characters throughout this video, he is also telling a story along the way with humor, but it is not a continuous stream of characters.  It is a short history of ventriloquism through out time.  He tells how he became interested in being one at a young age, then how he made it happen, and who his mentor was, and of course the show that made him well known.
Dated.
One of best ventriloquists right up there with Jeff Dunham and Terry Fator
such a funny guy!

I had never seen Jay Johnson other than on Soap, and didn't know what to expect.  He is a good ventriloquist, as well as a good comedian.  In addition, this show included interesting information about the history and craft of ventriloquism, the story of his journey from budding performer to successful showman, and a touching tribute to his mentor.  Surprisingly entertaining the entire length of a two-hour show.

this video was so wonderful that we watched it again the other day..it told such a great story besides using his puppets..it brought much laughter, and even some tears..I would definitely recommend seeing this video..it was wonderful and fun...I wish we had more of his stuff to choose from cause we would watch it all...
Parts of this made me laugh till I hurt! It's an entertainment experience; educational but mostly a show by a Master Craftsman. A GREAT SHOW!!!
Worth every minute. Clever, informative, and some very big laughs.

A great combination of ventriloquism, history and storytelling. Each entertainer has their own specialty and Jay appears to be more a storyteller than ventriloquist, but still entertaining. Has some serious sad moments mixed between quips of humor. For those that like only to laugh at funny puppets, it may not hold their attention. For those that like artful storytelling, he is the ultimate entertainer.

I try to watch an entire production before reviewing it, but in this case, though I am only 14 minutes into the show, I needed to come to Amazon to share my thoughts. Jay Johnson is brilliant. In this show, he doesn't only entertain, but he also takes you through the history of ventriloquism, going all the way back to its roots! Each segment with a dummy is prefaced by a history lesson that is as fascinating as natural gift for the art. This may be the best ventriloquist show I have ever watched!
What an amazing show. So funny & you'll laugh out loud, enjoying it.

Description says it covers a lot other than the Bob and Ted characters from SOAP.  Almost didn't buy it.  But it is a fascinating DVD and really funny.  Have watched it several times.  Definitely a must buy - if you liked him on SOAP you'll really like him after seeing this DVD.
MYSELF AND MY GRANDDAUGHTER LOVE IT.
Good watch for ventriloquist stardom.
Great & funny history on ventriloquism.  If you like the art of ventriloquism you'll enjoy this.
Jay is clearly a talented ventriloquist.  He is also really full of himself.  I couldn't finish watching the whole show, I just got tired of his possibly deserved bragging.
Probably the most amazing ventriloquist I've ever seen. Interesting story of his development, with many excellent demonstrations of his ability. Great show.
Not only did I laugh, but I also learned some things, which I didn't expect from a comedy routine.

I saw this show on Broadway in 2006.  It still is as good as I remembered- sweet, funny, and entertaining.  Jay Johnson is a talented ventriloquist, and good comedian.  He voices props other than puppets with great success. The show additionally provides a history lesson on the practice of ventriloquism. Johnson is superior to Jeff Dunham in every way.

Without a doubt, this is THE BEST live film I have ever seen. Bryan Simon's 8-Camera shoot at Thalian Hall beautifully capture's Jay Johnson's Tony-Award winning theatrical experience. I pit this against any filmed concert or theater production, and I bet you it comes out on top. There has never been a cinematic style that so aids in the storytelling, you feel like you're actually there. I'm only mentioning the film itself because the fact that the show captured hear won a Tony Award means the quality of entertainment speaks for itself. I had the chance to interview both Simon and Johnson on the eve of this film's release in December 2014. Here's the link so you can hear more about it: http://talk4two.com/2015/06/episode-61-the-making-of-jay-johnson-the-two-and-only-film/
Funny
Fantastic Show!!! A Master
I Like This Too Plus I Seen Him In Other Show's
I remember watching him as a kid. He is still as great as ever.  LOVED it.
Pretty funny. A little slow at times and a few "F" bombs, but other than that the last 1/3 is pretty funny.
Fator's DVDs are better. Jay talks to much and not enough puppet.
Best ventriloquists I seen.
A very personal story well worth watching
It was nice to see Jay Johnson on stage, again; he is still the best ventriloquist working today.
Very Funny
This is an excellent portrayal of Jay Johnson's talent in a unique media format.
short but very sweet

This is a must see show for anyone who really loves ventriloquism.  Jay Johnson is one of those few ventriloquists who have feet in both ventriloquism's past, and its future, and his historical insight into his own talent and art are those of a well learned man who seeks to impart just a bit of the wonder he has experienced in his study of the art to a greater audience.  As such, he is part philosopher, part educator, and part artist, in equal measure.  As other reviewers have noted, this is a very moving piece, especially those parts that deal with Jay's personal relationship with one of the singular great ventriloquists and puppet designers of the 20th Century.  It is not in the least pedantic or dull as some reviewers seem to think it is.  This is one of those shows that I will personally watch more than once, and that cannot be said, at least for myself, for about 90% of what passes for cinematic art.

Yes, Brilliant is the word. Maybe even phenomenal.  His humor is bright and distinctive. I have never seen Jay perform before, and throughout the show I marveled at his talent.  Jeff Dunham is a huge favorite of mine, but the more I watched Jay perform, the more I  believe he has acquired a greater command of the art.  I, personally, not only  loved  the history and illustrations he furnished about ventriloquism,  but  delighted in his experiences and life story.  I think anyone who watches this man's video can't help but come away from it with more joy in their heart than before.  If they do not, I would then have to question the existence of one.

An amazing talent, too bad he was long winded!  The story of ventriloquism was interesting, but jeez, give it a break.  The majority of folks are not as passionate as you are Jay . The characters, the delivery, the ingenuity all were magnificent. If it was not for the ramblings connecting the characters I would have easily given this a 4.5.
Amazing talent and wonderful humor - loved it
Such a joy to watch.  Jay is such a talented ventriloquist/entertainer, and his routines and story-telling abilities are brilliant Bravo, Jay!
I guess I am too used to Jeff Dunham.  Jay's humour is too bland for me.  I would rather be entertained...not listen to a story.

Not what expected an insight of ventriloquism and Jay Johnson's  life. But it was better than I expected, very very funny and very interesting. Jay is a very talented guy.  Already watched it twice and made me laugh out loud both times. A well deserved five stars.
It was a very good show. Better than I was expecting it to be.
Exceeded all expectations. I laughed and learned from (my opinion) the greatest ventriloquist of all time.  Would recommend to everybody.
Great entertainment!
Excellent and funny and insightful.... Enjoy.
What a talent.  Remarkable.

After watching this DVD, you'll know why Jay won a Tony Award! This show is so funny, moving and everything that goes along with those words, that even if you don't know Jay Johnson from the show SOAP, you will find this performance extremely compelling and joyful to watch.
Wonderful!

I watched this on Prime the other night. And I thoroughly enjoyed it! Great story telling, & comedy bit, also. I always wonder if the stories that comedians tell are true or just made up. Everything I found, backed up Jay's entire story. I just wish he would put out more dvds.

Jay Johnson is a virtuoso ventriloquist and this show demonstrates his incredible talent in a performance that is funny, poignant and highly entertaining. Jay tells us the history of ventriloquism through the ages and his own personal history with ventriloquism. It is a wonderful journey. Along the way we get to see Jay with a cast of characters that are all him, yet completely separate! I love this DVD and got a bunch to give for Christmas presents, even for friends who were not necessarily fans of ventriloquism. When you get down it, it is simply a great show, a great performance by a superb artist at the peak of his powers.
Excellent video. Both funny and serious. Jay Johnson is a true artist.

Art definitely matters! Some time has passed since I've read a review of JayJohnson:The Two and Only DVD , so here's my take:

Jay is not only an entertaining master storyteller, with his blending on the history of ventriloquism (dummies, or as he refers, "wooden Americans") to his personal journey in meeting Art Sieving, from Springfield , IL  and coming full circle in his career, after his run on the beloved and hilarious comedy, "Soap" we are transported on his journey through heart and soul.

Jay Johnson is brilliant in communicating his art of ventriloquism, as beening of "more than ordinary significance!" Complicated moments of genius between himself and his character Bob, including a tape over their mouth bit, exude his joy of the art, and mastery of skill.

Jay, along with Bryan W. Simon's gifted direction, has inspired me to write my own journey through Ventriloquism to present later 2015.

If you haven't seen this wonderfully entertaining performance yet, what are you waiting for?

All the best in life & art!

http://www.amazon.com/Jay-Johnson-Two-Only/dp/B00R3F6XMY/ref=sr_1_2?s=movies-tv&ie=UTF8&qid=1422143196&sr=1-2&keywords=two+and+only
Hilarious and heartwarming!

This is a wonderful video, especially for those who remember the Big Jon and Sparkie radio show from the 1950s.  It made me laugh and it made me cry. Jay Johnson gives a remarkable performance with a lot of fun characters. It is also appropriate for children to view.

Some have complained that this is the wrong video - it isn't. Just saw the whole thing, and it's just as good as the first time I saw the show, ten years ago. Only much more recent! If there were any streaming issues, they have been fixed.

I can confirm as well, that the right show plays now for Two and Only.

It's really a wonderful show, and so much more then a ventriloquism act.  It's a history lesson, the power imagination, as well as the love for your art.  It made my wife cry and me tear up at the end (you will know when).

And of course, it's a monkey joke too.
Wonderful DVD!  Loved the information about the history of ventriloquy and then Jay's personal history.  He is very talented and quite the philosopher too!

Jay Johnson is one of the true masters of the art of ventriloquism. Yes, the art of ventriloquism. Just as not every painter is an artist, few ventriloquists attain a level of mastery that would qualify them as artists in the from. Jay Johnson certainly does--and then some.

This DVD faithfully captures the Tony-award winning show as it was on Broadway. In it we learn about Jay's show business career, discover some of the history of ventriloquism and learn the story of Jay and his mentor, Art Sieving. There are laughs aplenty and some very touching moments. You will surprise yourself with tears when Jay has to explain a difficult show business choice to his first puppet. And I challenge you to keep a dry eye when Jay describes his last meeting with his mentor's puppet.

Through all shine Jay's artistry, his superb technique, his humor and, most important, his humanity. You may remember him from the hit show "Soap," but you will never forget him in "Two and Only."

I've seen this show live several times and it never fails to blow me away.
Jay Johnson is a master of his craft. I had to have this one in my library to enjoy
over and over again.

I was finally able to watch this beautiful show. If you are a fan of ventriloquism and you have seen all the rest, when you watch this you realize that Jay is simply the best. His ease of voice and grace of character is flawless. It is very easy to see that ALL current ventriloquists owe Jay a debt of gratitude. He brought ventriloquism into its modern iteration and made the dummy no dummy.

I saw the show in London and loved it. I have been watching it tonight on DVD and it is just as clever and funny as I remember. The aspect I had forgotten was how moving it is. Get the tissues ready!!

Someone has this video messed up!  everything starts out like you are going to watch Jay Johnson, the  show is A Richard Lewis show "a  bomb"  never liked his comedy.... Hope they fix this video, because I do like Jay Johnson..
He needs more video specials.

Jay Johnson is the greatest living ventriloquist. I saw his Broadway show and just watched the film. He not only delivers an hilarious banter between himself and the infamous Bob, his partner from the TV series SOAP, but also takes us on his own personal journey into ventriloquism and his relationship to a mentor, which is both touching and funny. Jay introduces us to some other great characters, including a talking tennis ball. This film is a terrific way to see his Tony Award winning production.

Went to this show when it was on Broadway and had a blast. What a great way to experience a Tony award winning Broadway show in your living room.  It's not just a comedy routine.  You will learn about the art of Ventriloquism, share Jay's personal story, laugh, cry and smile all the way though.  A not to be missed show, get this for everyone you know as a great Holiday Gift...just saying....;-)

This is a phenominal performance.  Jay Johnson manages to give us comedy, art, and a lesson on the history of ventriloquism all at once.  What seperates this from other ventriloquism performances (aside frome Jay's incredible talent), is that it takes the act off of the stand up comedy stage and puts it in legitamate theater.  It brings more than laughs (although there are plenty to be found), it gives us something to ponder.  It's a show you'll want to talk about with friends afterwards.  It's a show that's highly entertaining and inspiring.  I highly reccomend it.
Great
I remember him from the series SOAP, and always liked him. I was just interested to see how he was on his own after all these years. Well, I did enjoy the show and happy I bought the DVD.
Loved it! Loved Jay's personal history and the history of ventriloquism. So glad I got this.

I found this to be very disappointing, especially after reading all the glowing reviews.  I couldn't finish it. I just did not find Jay Johnson funny and I really wanted to! I loved him in Soap, but now I know why his dummy got the best lines! Maybe some day I will dare to watch it again and maybe re-evaluate it. Not right now, though!

This is one of the best works & performances Jay (one if the vest ventriloquists of all time)  has given to the world.

My only regret is that a few reviewers here have somehow confused a comedy-drama with reality.

It is a play, albeit based on of very personal experiences.

Jay is one of the most brilliant ventriloquiak comnedians, and one if the most humble guys there are.
Killer
strange
Great show, and the shipping was quick and the CD reasonably priced
Too serious. I expected it to be very funny

I have watched this 7 times myself and have shown it to several groups of friends who all loved it and thanked me for sharing it with them.  Jay is THE BEST vent out there and this Tony-award winning one man show is just incredible.  You will laugh ALOT and maybe cry a bit.  HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!!!!!!!!!
